thread.title: Red Demons drop first district game 52-33
thread.title_full: Red Demons drop first district game 52-33

author: John Zetmeir / Dodge City Daily Globe
title: Red Demons drop first district game 52-33
text: Red Demons drop first district game 52-33 Comment By John Zetmeir / Dodge City Daily Globe Dodge   By John Zetmeir / Dodge City Daily Globe Posted Oct. 16, 2015 at 10:35 PM Updated at 10:35 PM By John Zetmeir / Dodge City Daily Globe Posted Oct. 16, 2015 at 10:35 PM Dodge City, Kan. The Dodge City Red Demons gave the Wichita city league champions everything they had in the start of district play Friday night but in the matchup of two explosive offenses, it was Wichita Northwest’s (7-0) defense who were able to slow down the Red Demons in the 52-33 loss. After both teams entered the halftime break tied at 28-28, Northwest outscored the Red Demons 24-5 in the second half. Dodge City was able to move the ball through the air but when they needed to run the ball, the athletic Northwest defense showed why they have made it tough for teams all season long. "We struggled to find an identity offensively," head coach Dave Foster said on the radio following the game. "We couldn’t run the football. When you can’t run the football, I’m not sure you can win games. That puts tremendous pressure on (quarterback) Caden (Walters) and our offensive line." Walters threw the ball nearly 70 times on Friday and completed over 50 perfect of his passes. In his final game at Memorial Stadium, Walters threw two touchdown passes and ran for one more. Senior defensive end Noah Williams intercepted quarterback Jake Devereaux and returned it 85 yards for a Red Demon touchdown in the second quarter which gave Dodge City a 21-14. It was the first of two turnovers that the Red Demons forced in the game. Dodge City (4-3, 3-0) will head to Hutchinson next Friday for their second district game. Both the Red Demons and the Salthawks lost their first game of district play. Despite the loss to Northwest, there were positives that the Red Demons can take away from Friday’s game. "A year ago we weren’t even in the game at the half and tonight we’re tied up," Foster said. "That’s the number one team in the state. We gave ourselves a chance to compete to win. I told the kids that you played with some tremendous heart." Kickoff is scheduled for 7 p.m. next Friday. Wichita Northwest 14 14 17 7 - 52 Dodge City 14 14 3 2 - 33 Scoring Summary Northwest, Joyner 5 run. Kick good. 7-0 Dodge City, Walters 5 run. Kick good. 7-7 Northwest, Rounds 26 run. Kick good. 14-7 Dodge City, Walters to Adams 12 pass. Kick good. 14-14 2nd Dodge City, Williams 85 interception. Kick good. 14-21 Northwest, Folsom to Bott 5 pass. Kick good. 21-21 Northwest, Folsom to Joyner 27 pass 28-21 Dodge City, Walters to McGroarty 18 pass. 28-28. 3rd Dodge City, McGroarty 25 kick. 28-31 Northwest, Deckinger 22 kick. 31-31 Northwest, Folsom to Bott 87 pass. Kick good. 38-31 Northwest, Folsom to Bott 50 pass. Kick good. 45-31.
